intro: Genista paivae, commonly known as the Paiva's broom, is a flowering plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its typical pod fruits and nitrogen-fixing ability. The plant features slender, spiny stems and small, bright yellow flowers that bloom in spring. Its leaves are compound, consisting of several oval-shaped leaflets. Genista paivae is often found in rocky or coastal habitats, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
